intro: Pterophylla eriocarpa, commonly known as the woolly leaf shrub, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
